oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drug Therapy in Urology
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Low, Donald G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: drug therapy
urology
urinary tract infections
urolithiasis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Drug therapy for diseases of the urinary system, like diseases of other organ systems, is most successful when utilized in association with an accurate diagnosis and proper dose, dosage form, intervals of administration and duration of therapy. There must also be good compliance in utilization of the drug and appropriate regard for toxicity and adverse drug reactions. In an attempt to pursue drug therapy in urology in an orderly fashion, the various diseases, syndromes or symptom complexes will be briefly introduced as necessary to clarify the therapeutic approach suggested. Because of the broad scope of drugs used in urology this paper will be limited to those used in urinary tract infections and in urolithiasis.
